channel.title: Environment and public health on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Library
channel.description: Recent content in Environment and public health on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Library

item.title: Intro
item.description:
~ * ~ Any work shop intro materials ~ * ~

Breathe Easy Berkshires

“BEAT’s Breathe Easy Berkshires program monitors the ambient air quality in Pittsfield. We’re looking for sources of pollution that can be discussed with our community and reduced to improve air quality and health for the people of Pittsfield.” - www.thebeatnews.org/BeatTeam

breatheasyberkshires.org

Peaking power plants - Pittsfield has 12 year life span differential depending on neighborhood. Data related to peaker plants // spatial analysis with air quality monitor locations.

item.title: 1. Searching for and understanding data
item.description:
• Where did we find it? Looking at source

  • Looking at the TRI metadata for metadata discussion
  • Look at them both in HGL
  • [] [] [] images for these records when they’re available

item.title: 2. Opening and understanding GIS files
item.description:
Look at the EJ pop data to understand:

  • the structure of the files (like people open them and look at them)
  • the codes to use

item.title: Visualizing data
item.description: Use canopy (graduated) and EJ pop (categorical) to demo diff kinds of maps Show split screen thing if time
